claim.text: DAMCS outperforms both MARL and LLM baselines in task efficiency and collaboration.
claim.exact_quote: DAMCS outperforms both MARL and LLM baselines in task efficiency and collaboration.

evidence.evidence_text: Figure 6 and Table 1 show that DAMCS outperforms both MARL and LLM baselines in task efficiency and collaboration, with the six-agent scenario with communication completing tasks in 39% fewer steps compared to a single LLM Mem agent with memory and 74% fewer steps compared to the LLM basic agent.

claim.text: The six-agent scenario with communication significantly outperforms all other methods.
claim.exact_quote: The six-agent scenario with communication significantly outperforms all other methods.

evidence.evidence_text: Figure 6 shows that the six-agent scenario with communication significantly outperforms all other methods, completing tasks in fewer steps.

claim.text: The introduction of the Structured Communication System (S-CS) allowed agents to efficiently manage resource collection by dynamically assigning roles during gameplay.
claim.exact_quote: The introduction of the Structured Communication System (S-CS) allowed agents to efficiently manage resource collection by dynamically assigning roles during gameplay.

evidence.evidence_text: The introduction of the Structured Communication System (S-CS) allowed agents to efficiently manage resource collection by dynamically assigning roles during gameplay, as seen in the six-agent scenario with communication in Figure 6.

claim.text: The full LLM MemComm framework, combining both memory and structured communication, significantly outperformed both, reducing redundant actions and optimizing task distribution.
claim.exact_quote: The full LLM MemComm framework, combining both memory and structured communication, significantly outperformed both, reducing redundant actions and optimizing task distribution.

evidence.evidence_text: The full LLM MemComm framework, combining both memory and structured communication, significantly outperformed both, reducing redundant actions and optimizing task distribution, as shown in Figure 6 and Table 1.

claim.text: The Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory System (A-KGMS) enables agents to learn from past experiences, facilitating task completion in open-world environments.
claim.location: Section 3.2 Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory System
claim.exact_quote: The Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory System (A-KGMS) enables agents to learn from past experiences, facilitating task completion in open-world environments.

evidence.evidence_text: The Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory System (A-KGMS) enables agents to learn from past experiences, facilitating task completion in open-world environments, as demonstrated by the LLM Mem agent's ability to plan better using past experiences in the single-agent scenario.

claim.text: The Structured Communication System (S-CS) ensures that agents exchange only the most relevant information, minimizing unnecessary communication overhead.
claim.exact_quote: The Structured Communication System (S-CS) ensures that agents exchange only the most relevant information, minimizing unnecessary communication overhead.

evidence.evidence_text: The Structured Communication System (S-CS) ensures that agents exchange only the most relevant information, minimizing unnecessary communication overhead, as demonstrated by the reduced number of steps in the six-agent scenario with communication in Figure 6.

claim.text: The proposed framework, DAMCS, leverages LLMs and a hierarchical Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory System (AKGMS) to improve multi-agent cooperation in dynamic environments.
claim.location: Section 3 Decentralized Cooperative Framework for Generative Agents
claim.exact_quote: The proposed framework, DAMCS, leverages LLMs and a hierarchical Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory System (AKGMS) to improve multi-agent cooperation in dynamic environments.

evidence.evidence_text: The proposed framework, DAMCS, leverages LLMs and a hierarchical Adaptive Knowledge Graph Memory System (AKGMS) to improve multi-agent cooperation in dynamic environments, as described in Section 3.
evidence.location: Section 3 Decentralized Cooperative Framework for Generative Agents
